chargeHist.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Alicia Marie Wienandt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: *Consecutive to any sentence she is currently serving

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

TO BE DETERMINED: 
*Pay restitution to Covantage - to be held open for 30 days to allow the District Attorney's Office time to verify the amount of restitution, if any
*Defendant entitled to a restitution hearing, if not in agreement with the State's restitution request

*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time; if not doing either then she is to perform 9 hours of
community service each week

*Participate in any counseling, treatment or assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
*Submit DNA sample

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alicia Marie Wienandt

defendant.name: Wienandt, Alicia Marie
defendant.address: 751 County Rd K PO BOX 3100, DOC #606854 c/o Taych, Fond du Lac, WI 54936

records.addlTxt:
The defendant respectfully requests that the judgment of
conviction be amended to show that restitution is $0 (zero)
Notice of Completion of Representation filed by Atty Anne Renc

Count 1:  Dismissed and Read In
Count 2:  Sentence Withheld and Placed on Probation

1:36 PM Defendant Alicia Marie Wienandt appeared by video. in custody at Taycheedah Correctional Institution.  Attorney Anne Renc appeared by video for Alicia Marie Wienandt.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA)Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CF74, 22CM48 and 22CM40.

Court calls the cases.
ADA Cassidy states the appearances.

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to via video ZOOM and confirms that she can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
If at any time the defendant needs to speak privately with her attorney, the court will make accommodations for that.
Defendant indicates she understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with her attorney.
BY THE COURT: Court finds the defendant is knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily consenting to use ZOOM appearance.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
22CF74:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In
Count 2 - No contest

22CM48:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In

22CM40:
Count 1 - No contest

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 2 on 22CF74:  Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000) 943.82(1); as a Repeater 939.62(1)(b).  Guilty of Count 1 on 22CM40:  Issue of Worthless Checks (<=$2500) 943.24(1); as a Repeater 939.62(1)(b).
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
Dismissed and Read In:
22CM48 - Count 1
22CF74 - Count 1 

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

2:02 p.m.  ADA Cassidy makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
2:09 p.m.  Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Defendant makes a brief statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
22CF74:
Count 2 -
Sentence Withheld
Placed on Probation for a Period of 48 months - consecutive to any sentence she is currently serving
**Conditions of Probation:
Pay restitution to Covantage - to be held open for 30 days to allow the District Attorney's Office time to verify the amount of restitution, if any
Defendant entitled to a restitution hearing, if not in agreement with the State's restitution request
Participate in any counseling, treatment or assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time; if not doing either then she is to perform 9 hours of community service each week
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample 

22CM40:
Count 1 -
Impose but STAY a 9 month jail sentence to the Portage County Jail - if probation is revoked then jail sentence to be served consecutive to any other sentence she is serving at that time
Placed on Probation for a Period of 12 Months - consecutive to any sentence she is currently serving
**Conditions of Probation:
Pay restitution to BP Gas Station in the amount of $141.63
Participate in any counseling, treatment or assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time; if not doing either then she is to perform 9 hours of community service each week
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample

**Faxed Signature Bond to Portage County Jail to forward to Taycheedah for signature/return sp**
Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed by Atty Anne Renc

2:48 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Alicia Marie Wienandt appeared by video, Attorney Anne Renc for Alicia Marie Wienandt appeared in court. 

All files heard: 22CM40, 22CM48, 22CF74
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Atty Renc indicates the defendant will waiver her right to preliminary hearing in 22CF74 but she has not gotten the written waiver returned yet. 

22CF74:  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment conducted: 
Court questions the defendant regarding her waiver. 
Court questions Atty Renc. 
BY THE COURT:  Court accepts the waiver on the basis of the complaint that's been filed, sufficient probable cause found the defendant is bound over for trial. 
Atty Renc states they are prepared to proceed with the understanding the information will be filed mirroring the charges in the complaint. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered on all files.

Atty Cassidy requests bond: 
22CF74 a $1,500 signature bond with conditions of no contact with the Save A Lot store in Stevens Point.
22CM48 a $250 signature bond with no additional conditions. 
22CM40 a $250 signature bond with no contact with the 1039 BP Station located at 4928 Main Street in Stevens Point. 

Atty Renc makes bond arguments and requests a cash bond to cover all files with the conditions requested by the state. 
Atty Cassidy makes statements. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court sets signature bonds in each of the cases: 
22CF74 as requested. 
22CM48 as requested. 
22CM40 as requested.
No contact with the Save A Lot store in Stevens Point.
Pre-trial conference on May 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
filed by Atty Anne Renc
